title: 1964 Norwegian First Division
text:
The 1964 <a href="Eliteserien">1. divisjon</a> was the 20th completed season of top division <a href="association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Norway">Norway</a>.
Overview.
It was contested by 10 teams, and <a href="Lyn%20Fotball">FC Lyn Oslo</a> won their first championship title. At the time, Lyn Oslo's 26 points were a record for the most points in one season. <a href="SK%20Brann">Brann</a> and <a href="Raufoss%20IL">Raufoss</a> were relegated to the <a href="1.%20divisjon">2. divisjon</a>.
This season, two spots in the <a href="European%20Cup">European Cup</a> were awarded. Lyn lead the league after 9 rounds and qualified for the <a href="1964%E2%80%9365%20European%20Cup">1964–65 European Cup</a>. At the end of the season, Lyn won the league, their first league title, and qualified also for the <a href="1965%E2%80%9366%20European%20Cup">1965–66 European Cup</a>. This was the last Norwegian top flight season, the leader after half a season were awarded a European Cup spot.
